###

## Add permalink template read only property to Product REST api

### Description

We currently have to retrieve the `permalink_template` and `generated_slug` separately from the WP posts endpoint in order to show a permalink for draft products. This is causing an unnecessary extra delay when loading products.

We should add the `permalink_template` and `generated_slug` properties as readonly fields to the Products REST api.
We can use the same logic as what Wordpress uses for the posts endpoint -> https://github.com/WordPress/WordPress/blob/master/wp-includes/rest-api/endpoints/class-wp-rest-posts-controller.php#L1950-L1964

A `getPermalinkParts` selector has already been added to the products data store and can be re-used once we updated the products REST api endpoint to use that instead ( this was added as part of https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/pull/34313 ).

This task will include:
- The addition of two readonly fields as part of the products REST api ( https://woocommerce.github.io/woocommerce-rest-api-docs/#retrieve-a-product )
- Updating the `getPermalinkParts` selector to make use of the products REST api data store instead of the posts data store.

Design:
5sAIeTRd9Yp7nSCT33BAWz-fi-6135%3A243581

Some extra context in this Slack thread, including an idea to add it as a readonly field instead: p1660331212163919-slack-C0E1AV8T0

###

In WooCommerce Payments, we display a task list in Payments > Overview, using [`CollapsibleList`](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/trunk/packages/js/experimental/src/experimental-list/collapsible-list/index.tsx) and [`TaskItem`](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/trunk/packages/js/experimental/src/experimental-list/task-item/index.tsx) from '@woocommerce/experimental' (see [here](https://github.com/Automattic/woocommerce-payments/blob/0b2030b7a99210461f5a3a35b97f9400a3a1654c/client/overview/task-list/index.js#L177-L219));

We noticed that the dismiss action from the ellipses menu gets cut off when we open it. The text is not readable and it's impossible to dismiss the task (see the issue raised: https://github.com/Automattic/woocommerce-payments/issues/4470).
This is only happening when the Gutenberg plugin is also installed. Gutenberg comes with `@wordpress/components` v20.0.0 and WooCommerce Payments bundles v11.1.5, so once Gutenberg is installed, the site is using v20.0.0.

![Screen Recording 7-21-2022 at 8 45 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5121465/180345688-ef7d402b-499e-4ee1-a438-9a727309f0e8.gif)

The same behavior can be observed in the TaskList StoryBook: https://woocommerce.github.io/woocommerce-admin/components/storybook/?path=/story/woocommerce-admin-experimental-list--task-item-example

It looks like this is due to a change in how the ellipsis menu is built in `@wordpress/components`. There used to be a `position: fixed` on one of the `<div>` from the ellipsis menu (v11.1.5), and I can see now that it uses `position: absolute`. 
And the TaskItem defines a class with an `overflow: hidden` rule (see [here](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/ea6a0d31f999a60f99b3625071b860476255629a/plugins/woocommerce-admin/client/tasks/task-list.scss#L2)), which now affects the absolute positioned div from the menu (while it had no effects on it when it was fixed).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28830738/191742281-e796e546-5ce6-4e8f-a271-201730f20c67.png)

We may just need to remove the `position: relative` on `woocommerce-experimental-list__item` and move it one level up, to avoid having the absolute div relatively positioned to the element with hidden overflow.

### Expected behavior

When clicking on the ellipsis menu from a task, we can see the content and dismiss the task.

### Actual behavior

When clicking on the ellipsis menu from a task, we cannot see the content and dismiss the task.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to https://woocommerce.github.io/woocommerce-admin/components/storybook/?path=/story/woocommerce-admin-experimental-list--task-item-example
2. Click on the ellipsis menu and observe that the content cannot be seen properly

Package release does not handle the initial case very well. The changelog (or lack thereof) causes problems.

If a package doesn't exist the release prep fails because there is no changelog. This initial case should be handled explicitly, maybe by passing a flag to explicitly set the initial version? Here is an example new package https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/pull/36600

1. A blank changelog file. 
```
# Changelog

This project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

The prep command should work, setting the initial versions correctly and creating an entry in the changelog.

```
./tools/package-release/bin/dev prepare @woocommerce/<package-name>

**Description**
As part of #36394 we will be creating a slot fill component to add new tabs to the product page. **Description:**
Part of the https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/issues/35952 epic.
This currently is not very doable with our current implementation of tabs. Currently our use of [`TabPanel`](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/trunk/packages/components/src/tab-panel) relies on having nested children with the `ProductFormTab` component which won't be possible with the SlotFills as fills will be wrapped by the Slot component.

Also note that the `TabPanel` component requires the tab name, title, and className as standalone data.

There could be a couple options (part of this issue is determining the best approach):
- Refactor our current use of `TabPanel` within [ProductFormLayout](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/trunk/plugins/woocommerce-admin/client/products/layout/product-form-layout.tsx#L15) to integrate fills, we can make use of the `useSlot` hooks for these and retrieve the necessary data from there. 
- Integrate tabs directly with the `WooProductFormTabItem` fill component as part #36394, asking for the additional title, name data.
- Make use of a React provider within our use of `TabPanel` in [ProductFormLayout](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/trunk/plugins/woocommerce-admin/client/products/layout/product-form-layout.tsx#L15) and instead of relying on Children we have `ProductFormTab` register within the provider. This way it doesn't matter if tabs are direct children and we can more freely use the SlotFill component for this.

**Acceptance criteria**
- [ ] Our product form tabs should be easily extendable by the use of slot fills.
- [ ] The product form tabs should work and look the same as they do now.

This bug was found in https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce-min-max-quantities/issues/176 and is reported here as a core issue.

The quantity input box is not shown when a product's min qty and max qty are the same. The code responsible for this can be found [here](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/trunk/plugins/woocommerce/templates/global/quantity-input.php#L20-L25). I think the reasoning behind it could be that if the user cannot set the quantity of the product anyways, then what's the point of showing input box. 

However, this creates an issue that the user does not know what the quantity is, so IMO it's better if the quantity input is disabled when `min_qty=max_qty`.

### Expected behaviour

Input quantity is shown when min_qty=max_qty

### Actual behavior

Input quantity is not shown when min_qty=max_qty

### Steps to reproduce

1. Add https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce-min-max-quantities/ plugin.
2. Create a simple product with min_qty=max_qty=5
3. Add product to the cart.

You will see that the qty input box is no longer visible. If you change the min qty to 4, you'll be able to see the quantity input box.

Following the merge of [PR#36282](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/pull/36282), visiting the order editor when HPOS is enabled (and authoritative) results in a number of notice-level errors:

```
Attempt to read property "ID" on null
plugins/woocommerce/includes/admin/class-wc-admin-post-types.php:128
```

The problem is that the [global `$post` object](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/2bf9f577952d7a225365fe7728b3187b5be7b701/plugins/woocommerce/includes/admin/class-wc-admin-post-types.php#L123) is not set under these conditions, and therefore [attempts to get the `$post->ID`](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/2bf9f577952d7a225365fe7728b3187b5be7b701/plugins/woocommerce/includes/admin/class-wc-admin-post-types.php#L128) (there are multiple cases of this, in this block of code) will fail. 

Solving this for `$messages['products']` is probably trivial, but we can see a [similar problem in `$messages['shop_order']`](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/2bf9f577952d7a225365fe7728b3187b5be7b701/plugins/woocommerce/includes/admin/class-wc-admin-post-types.php#L158-L162). To solve that part elegantly, we may wish to first solve https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/issues/35561.

###

Particularly for the orders and products API endpoints, the objects in the response include a `meta_data` property which is an array of key/value pairs, representing postmeta. This array can be quite large in some cases, which can significantly increase the size of the response payload. The mobile apps only need a few specific meta keys, so I'm proposing that we add two new collection parameters for orders and products:

* `include_meta` would work similarly to `_fields` but only for meta keys. Only the keys specified would be retrieved and included in the response.
* `exclude_meta` would do the opposite, retrieving and including all meta keys except the ones specified.

In the case where both parameters are used in one request, I think `include_meta` would take precedence, since it would usually be more specific.

While working on a new feature I noticed we're not able to use images in CSS due to [`woocommerce-admin` webpack configuration](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/5324852223ec30beb70e90fe67262e0d06aad4f6/plugins/woocommerce-admin/webpack.config.js).

### Describe alternatives you've considered

We could keep loading assets in JS, but that will prevent us to use images with CSS backgrounds for example.

### Description

The products data store should be able to create product categories. It would be nice to also support updates, but that's not critical for the product page, which is the context for this work, and product image manipulation is probably another can of worms entirely.

_For now, this should be marked as experimental/internal as we iterate on the API so that it is clear that this is incomplete and subject to change_.

#### _Properties_

| Attribute | Type | Description | |
| --------- | --------- | --------- | --------- |
| id | integer | Unique identifier for the resource. | READ-ONLY |
| name | string | Category name. | MANDATORY |
| slug | string | An alphanumeric identifier for the resource unique to its type. | |
| parent | integer | The ID for the parent of the resource. | |
| description | string | HTML description of the resource. | |
| display | string | Category archive display type. Options: default, products, subcategories and both. Default is default. | |
| image | object | Image data. See [https://woocommerce.github.io/woocommerce-rest-api-docs/#product-category-image-properties](Product category - Image properties) | |
| menu_order | integer | Menu order, used to custom sort the resource. | |
| count | integer | Number of published products for the resource. | READ-ONLY |

_Most of our create operations will specify only the name, and as stated above, update functionality is just a nice-to-have at this point, especially wrt images._

**Reference**
> https://woocommerce.github.io/woocommerce-rest-api-docs/#product-category-properties

#### _Create_
**HTTP Request**
> **POST** `/wp-json/wc/v3/products/categories`

**Reference**
> https://woocommerce.github.io/woocommerce-rest-api-docs/#create-a-product-category

#### _Update_
**HTTP Request**
> **PUT** `/wp-json/wc/v3/products/categories/<id>`

**Reference**
> https://woocommerce.github.io/woocommerce-rest-api-docs/#update-a-product-category

### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Data store updates
- [ ] Unit tests
- [ ] Documentation with examples

It seems there are some gaps in the logic we used to manage default shipping zones and shipping task.

An example case would be a user from US who already has Jetpack installed but doesn't have WCS, they would not be able to see the shipping task, nor have the default shipping zones created. 

- The check for shipping task to appear [doesn't include US](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/b274831334fe8979ad7eaa4db579b030a7451019/plugins/woocommerce/src/Admin/Features/OnboardingTasks/Tasks/Shipping.php#L113)
- The [check for creating]( https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/trunk/plugins/woocommerce/src/Internal/Admin/Homescreen.php#L118:L122) shipping zones does not cover users who has Jetpack installed but not installed WCS

### Expected behavior

Ideally, I think we should have the logic consolidated where there will never be a case for users to neither have the shipping task visible nor shipping zones created. However, if this is too complicated, we should just fix the case mentioned above.

### Actual behavior

Edge case happens for some users

### Steps to reproduce

 1. Create a fresh site in the US, select physical products, install Jetpack in extension step
2. Observe no shipping task nor review shipping options in setup tasklist
3. Observe no shipping zones set

### Isolating the problem

- [X] I have deactivated other plugins and confirmed this bug occurs when only WooCommerce plugin is active.
- [X] This bug happens with a default WordPress theme active, or [Storefront](https://woocommerce.com/storefront/).
- [X] I can reproduce this bug consistently using the steps above.

### Discussed in https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/discussions/35709
Originally posted by **luissimo** November 24, 2022 Hi, I wanted to stir up a discussion about order return management for WooCommerce. We are running a big WooCommerce store with over 120k order/years and we are at a point that we need an external partner to integrate a return management solution for us. However all these third parties only partially support WooCommerce because there is no return management system. Such a system needs the following functionality - Register a return - Apply different states to a return (eg. Expected, In Progress, Approved, Completed) - Refund the return or create a coupon All the other big E-commerce platforms already have this functionality. - Shopify - Lightspeed - Magento 1 & Magento 2 - Shopware - BigCommerce The third parties(multiple) advise us explicitly to switch to a different platform. Which is something we are almost forced to do to keep everything running operationally. Sure there are some plugins that can do this but third parties don't support plugin functionality but only core functionality. And this is an essential part for any e-commerce website. Is this something that is planned or possible to integrate in the near future?

Sometimes some PRs don't require a changelog entry but still needs to be cherry picked into a release. Currently this fails because the cherry pick tool assumes a PR has a changelog file to be deleted and if it doesn't find it, it will fail. Ref: https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/runs/8231510935?check_suite_focus=true#step:9:1

### Expected behavior

Not to fail when there are no changelog entries to be deleted.

### Actual behavior

Currently fails if changelog entries are not found.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a test PR with changes that does not require a changelog entry such as `changelog.txt`.
2. Squash and merge the PR.
3. Assign the PR with a current milestone.
4. Go to the cherry pick tool action and witness it will fail.

Using the [Custom Order Types HPOS Screens](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/pull/35658) PR when viewing a filtering a custom order type, the `page` hidden input attribute is using the wrong value.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57298/204402614-dc491a6d-a062-4ea7-834f-d95231dc54d5.png)


### Expected behavior

A user should be able to filter by date or customer of a custom order type and the relevant results would be shown.

###

The ability to change the order of payment gateways was introduced in a previous update.

However regardless of the order that the gateways are dragged into in wp-admin, when you view the checkout page the default gateway is always whichever gateway was added/activated first.

### Expected behavior

I believe the correct behaviour should be that whichever payment gateway is first in the list, the radio button for selecting payment method should be set to this automatically - the inference being that the site admin will have put the preferred/most popular payment method first.

### Actual behavior

The checkout page lists the payment gateways in the order selected in wp-admin however the radio button is active for whichever payment gateway was added/activated first.

### Steps to reproduce

There are posts around with code to add to functions.php to set a default gateway, however I believe this is a bug that needs to be fixed.

The only non-code workaround I have worked out is to deactivate all payment gateways, then reactivate them with the preferred payment method activated first.

Example:

Site had three payment gateways activated as follows

Activated first - Cash on delivery
Activated second - BACS
Activated third - Stripe

Changing the order of these to display as:

Stripe
BACS
Cash on Delivery

still leaves the radio button active for Cash on Delivery

The workaround is to deactivate all payment gateways then reactivate them in the following order

1. Stripe
2. BACS
3. Cash on delivery

This results in Stripe being the active radio button on the checkout page.

The code needs to be corrected so that whichever payment gateway is listed first, the radio button is active for it on the checkout page.

**Description:** the UI for creating attributes is an error-prone and time-consuming experience. We should explore ways to streamline the experience with minimal effort.  

**Acceptance criteria- [ ] Add a tooltip near the "custom product attribute" dropdown and "add" CTA with a link to the support doc: https://woocommerce.com/document/managing-product-taxonomies/#section-6
- [ ] If there are no attributes in the store: show the add attribute form by default
- [ ] If there's at least one attribute: add an empty state screen with a choice between adding a custom attribute or importing an existing one

- [ ] The 2 expand/close options are confusing. Should we just keep one of them?
- [ ] Improve the visibility of the secondary actions: delete, etc. Should they be visible by default?
- [ ] Existing attribute options are always reset when added to a new product. Remember the last used settings for attributes, i.e. "Used for variations" and select all values by default so that the user doesn't have to add them manually

The current [experimental select control](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/tree/trunk/packages/js/components/src/experimental-select-control) forces the consumer of the component to handle all the async logic, this is in theory fine, but will require quite a bit of boiler plate for any async fields.

The Select Control also makes it a bit tricky to notify the user when the dropdown is searching or not.

Here are a couple suggestions that should be explored and/or implemented as part of this issue:
- Allow the `getFilteredItems` callback to support the return of a promise.
- Allow the addition of `useDebounce` for either the `getFilteredItems` function or `onInputChange`, maybe this should be a default of 250ms that can be changed if needed?

See [this PR](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/pull/34949) and the comments left behind by @mattsherman  for some extra context.

**Acceptance criteria**

- [ ] The `getFilteredItems` prop should support setting it to a Promise
- [ ] The `getFilteredItems` prop should support setting it to a regular function
- [ ] The `getFilteredItems` prop should be debounced, so that it isn't called for every input change
- [ ] A loading/busy indicator should be displayed as the `suffix` when the `getFilteredItems` callback is pending

The attributes of the quantity input field, min and max, are not updated when changing variation. 

The bug is located in the `VariationForm.prototype.onFoundVariation` method of the `assets/frontend/add-to-cart-variation.js` file.  Here, the $qty selector has changed, and instead of selecting the layer with the "quantity" class, as it did before, it selects the input:

`$qty = form.$singleVariationWrap.find( '.quantity input[name="quantity"]' ),`

For this reason the selection of the input, which is done later, does not work:

`var $qty_input = $qty.find( 'input.qty' )`

Since he is looking for himself ;)

For the later logic to work, the initial $qty selector must be changed to the way it was in the previous version, ie:

`$qty = form.$singleVariationWrap.find( '.quantity' ),`


### Expected behavior

Quantity input min and max attributes are updated on change of variance with stock restrictions.

### Actual behavior

The min and max attributes of the quantity input are NOT updated when changing variations with stock constraints, since the quantity input selector in the js file is incorrect.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a product with variations for some attribute.
2. Manage stock for variations with different stock limits.
3. In frontend, change attribute/variation option.
4. The quantity input does not take into account the stock restrictions of each variation

When using the php 8.0 apache module I get this error in woo:
`PHP Fatal error:  Only variables can be passed by reference in /htdocs/wp-content/plugins/woocommerce/includes/class-wc-download-handler.php on line 559`
It seems php 8.0 does not allow dereferencing of numbers. The manual seems quite clear on this:
https://www.php.net/manual/en/language.references.pass.php

If I switch to php8.0-fpm the error does not occur. The problem also doesn't occur with the php 7.4 module.

I think the line
`if ( function_exists( 'apache_setenv' ) ) {`
returns false under php-fpm which is why we only get the problem when using the module.
This change to the woo code works here:

From
```
if ( function_exists( 'apache_setenv' ) ) {
                        @apache_setenv( 'no-gzip', 1 ); // phpcs:ignore Generic.PHP.NoSilencedErrors.Discouraged, WordPress.PHP.DiscouragedPHPFunctions.runtime_configuration_apache_setenv
                }
```
To:
```
if ( function_exists( 'apache_setenv' ) ) {
                        $one    = 1;
                        @apache_setenv( 'no-gzip', $one ); // phpcs:ignore Generic.PHP.NoSilencedErrors.Discouraged, WordPress.PHP.DiscouragedPHPFunctions.runtime_configuration_apache_setenv
                }
```
We are on Debian 10.



### Expected behavior

Viewing the homepage should be possible.  A fatal error should not occur.

### Actual behavior

Homepage is not rendered, screen shows 
**There has been a critical error on this websiteApache error log file has fatal described above.

Email sent to site owner:
Error Details

An error of type E_COMPILE_ERROR was caused in line 559 of the file
/home/path/htdocs/wp-content/plugins/woocommerce/includes/class-wc-download-handler.php.
Error message: Only variables can be passed by reference

### Steps to reproduce

1.  Switch environment to apache's mod_php for php 8.0.
2. View website.
